Row.Text: The Dowager Empress of the Romans, Queen of Hungary, and the Archduchess of Austria greets you. Tell me, do you like... theatre?
So, you are the one who has been loafing about my court. I suppose I should welcome you to Austria, but I don't believe you'll be staying here all that long.
The Lady of the Wendish Mark welcomes your eminence to - Oh let's just get this over with. I have a luncheon at 4.
Is that how you behave in front of an Empress?
A fine victory I must say. I believe I shall commission an opera to record the details of your defeat.
I hope you're happy with yourself now. All that silly posturing, and yet nothing to back it up it seems.
You, you... evil brute! You're as uncivilized as the revolting Prussians!
A small loss, nothing to fret over. I've suffered and survived worse.
What a wretched world has this become, which treasures not beauty and wisdom born in age. I am almost glad to leave it.
Oh woe and pain upon you, foul and cruel beast. My curtain has fallen, the stage grows dark. How can one go on when the light has faded?
The House of Habsburg ends today, a proud and noble dynasty gone, demolished forever more. Only the heartless can sleep at night, knowing that they are the sole cause.
Perhaps, but I will need to think on it longer. Unless of course you're willing to sweeten the offer some, my dear?
Can you do a little better?
Quite presumptuous you are, but I do find I've taken quite a fancy to you - momentarily. Here, but do not ask again.
My dear, you'll have to speak a little clearer - my hearing is a little finicky. I'm sure I misheard you there.
I saw you eyeing my new damasks. Let it never be said I am an unfair woman - let us make a deal.
Right, come along now. The royal theatre needs a new roof and the hospital, inoculations. How much did you say you could donate again?
My dear, this simply will not do. My rule is already under question because of my gender, and it doesn't need any help from items like this.
Is that the best you can do?
Oh, I suppose I could spare just a little for my favorite little courtier. Run along now.
My dear, I received that silly letter you penned. You must have accidentally addressed it to me, as I know you'd never ask something like this.
I know you're just dying to have this latest fashion in your backwards nation!
Come, help a poor dowager-widow in her time of distress and need.
I have been a reigning sovereign longer than you have breathed air, child. I will not be taken in by such ridiculousness.
You must do better than that.
What abject buffoonery is this? You waste my time, and try my patience.
You will pay for this in time, you small-minded thief.
How it pleases me to deny you to your face. Do not let the chamber door hit you on the way out.
My advisors insist that I ask this of you. Tell me, do you make a habit of bribing my court officials?
Austria will turn her great attention elsewhere, if you make it worth her while. Have you seen the latest reports from Kolin?
Austria stands for these insults no longer! Arm yourself, stand proud, and prepare for your total annihilation.
A pity it has come to this, but you leave me little choice. Next time, I beseech you to choose your words more wisely.
What, surprised? How did you think I came by my titles and lands? Through my husband? No matter, you shall swiftly see your error.
You great fool! My army numbers over 100,000 men, and are each highly trained and well equipped. Your end shall be brutal and swift.
You take me lightly, and it will be your undoing. I am the Holy Roman Empress - centuries worth of courage and prowess are my right, and my mettle.
What insane path you have started down upon? I am no simple consort, content to paint and dream the day away. I am sovereign in my own right, as you will quickly learn.
I want to meet my God awake.
